fields.value: Reflections in the Glass: Teenage Poetry

authorAffiliation.value: University of Science, Arts and Technology

dsDescriptionValue.value:
About the author,  Anje’ Elise Tulp, age 13

Anje’ makes her home in the historic town of Morrison, Colorado, USA, where she is surrounded by Nature and her animals, including Deer, Elk, Bear, Fox,  Rabbits, Squirrel, Eagles, Hawks and other Mountain Birds, and numerous other species native to the area.   

Anje’ has mastered an International cultural perspective, having started her early education at the Shirley School,  Cambridge, England,  followed by St Mary’s Academy on St Mary’s Island, located in the Medway River, in Chatham, Kent, United Kingdom.   After a brief period of Independent study in Montserrat, British West Indies, she authored the present works at age 12.  Anje’ is currently enrolled in the prestigious Alpine Valley School, near Denver Colorado, where she is free to pursue her areas of interest and further develop her creative  talents as an Author and Artist.

This is a collection of over 30 original poems.

Morrison, Colorado, U.S.A.
Olveston, Montserrat, B.W.I.
MMXI, A.D.

Title ID: 3759648  © 2011 
ISBN-13: 978-1468149142

fields.value: This is a collection with illustrations of over 30 poems.
